availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Applegate (Pendleton County, Ky, sheriff, farmer; RR police guard, lieut 18th Ky Inf USA )

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, sheriff, farmer, and soldier. Married to Mary Ann "Katherine" Colvin Applegate in Pendleton County on November 10, 1841. Father of William McKendree Applegate, John B. Applegate, Mary N. Applegate, Lucius A. Applegate, James B. Applegate, Leslie T. Applegate, and Judith E. Applegate. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in Captain M. Mullins Company, Police Guard Kentucky Central Railroad as second lieutenant from October 18, 1861, to November 11, 1861. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and first lieutenant from October 13, 1861, to December 27, 1862. Sheriff in Pendleton County in 1863 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, First District, p. 363A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 444.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 2, p. 1 of 7 of microfilm.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct No. 1, p. 393A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film 000272800, p. 330.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 2, 854.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 203.
Find A Grave, "James T. Applegate (1819-1892)," Memorial #92432124, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92432124 (accessed July 2, 2019).
